name: Henry Ray POPE, III, as Trustee in the Bankruptcy of the 1717 Discretionary Fund. a Pennsylvania Limited Partnership, v. Barrie GIBBS and Richard H. Schall, Jr. Petition of Richard H. Schall, Jr.

parties: Henry Ray POPE, III, as Trustee in the Bankruptcy of the 1717 Discretionary Fund. a Pennsylvania Limited Partnership, v. Barrie GIBBS and Richard H. Schall, Jr. Petition of Richard H. Schall, Jr.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 18th day of April, 2000, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED, limited to the following two issues:
Is the decision of the Superior Court in the instant case in conflict with the previous decision of the Commonwealth Court in Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Dep’t of Commerce v. Carlow, 687 A.2d 22 (Pa.Commw.1996)?
Is the decision of the Superior Court in the instant case in conflict with the previous decision of this Court in Scott Factors, Inc. v. Hartley, 425 Pa. 290, 228 A.2d 887 (1967)?
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Paul David Burke, Pittsburgh, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
748 A.2d 1234
Henry Ray POPE, III, as Trustee in the Bankruptcy of the 1717 Discretionary Fund. a Pennsylvania Limited Partnership, v. Barrie GIBBS and Richard H. Schall, Jr. Petition of Richard H. Schall, Jr.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
April 18, 2000.
Paul David Burke, Pittsburgh, for petitioner.
